PreparerFirmName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: BOLINGER SEGARS GILBERT AND MOSS LLP

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: SHARING JESUS, HEALING HEARTS, TRANSFORMING LIVES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: SHARING JESUS, HEALING HEARTS, TRANSFORMING LIVES.
IRS990.Desc: TEXAS GIRLS & BOYS RANCH IS A CHRIST-CENTERED, FAITH-BASED AGENCY THAT PROVIDES 24-HOUR RESIDENTIAL CARE AND PROFESSIONAL COUNSELING SERVICES FOR CHILDREN THROUGH THREE SEPARATE LICENSED PROGRAMS. TEXAS GIRLS & BOYS RANCH IS NATIONALLY ACCREDITED THROUGH THE COUNCIL ON ACCREDITATION (COA). TRAUMA-INFORMED CARE AND EVIDENCE-BASED PRACTICES ARE AN ONGOING PART OF THE ORGANIZATION'S MILIEU OF CARE. IN ADDITION, A VARIETY OF COUNSELING SERVICES, INCLUDING EQUINE-ASSISTEDPSYCHOTHERAPY, ARE PROVIDED IN SUPPORT OF REUNIFICATION EFFORTS AND TO ASSIST IN THE TRANSITION OF CHILDREN IN CARE.THE RANCH OR CAMPUS PROGRAM PROVIDES CARE AND TREATMENT SERVICES FOR THE EMOTIONAL AND PHYSICAL NEEDS OF APPROXIMATELY 74 GIRLS AND BOYS (FREQUENTLY SIBLING GROUPS) WHO HAVE BEEN TRAUMATIZED BY PHYSICAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL ABUSE AND NEGLECT. TEXAS GIRLS & BOYS RANCH IS LICENSED TO SERVE 45 CHILDREN FROM AGES 3 TO ADULT. THE CHILDREN SERVED BY TEXAS GIRLS & BOYS RANCH ARE PRIMARILY WITHIN 150 MILES RADIUS. THE CHILDREN RESIDE IN A HOME-LIKE ENVIRONMENT AND LIVE IN 1 OF 4 DIFFERENT COTTAGES WITH LIVE-IN HOUSE PARENTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE CHILD PLACING AGENCY PROGRAM LICENSES FOSTER AND ADOPTIVE HOMES FOR CHILDREN, INCLUDING SIBLINGS, THAT HAVE EXPERIENCED ABUSE AND NEGLECT. IN 2022, TEXAS BOYS RANCH LICENSED ABOUT 41 FAMILIES, SERVED APPROXIMATELY 150 CHILDREN AND FINALIZED 11 ADOPTIONS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: THE TEXAS GIRLS & BOYS RANCH CHILDREN'S SHELTER SERVE CHILDREN, INCLUDING SIBLINGS, TYPICALLY AS THEY ENTER THE FOSTER CARE SYSTEM. SOME CHILDREN COME TO THE SHELTER BECAUSE THEIR PREVIOUS PLACEMENT HAD FAILED FOR ONE REASON OR ANOTHER. THE SHELTER IS A SHORT-TERM PLACEMENT FOR CHILDREN SO THAT THEY CAN BE ASSESSED AND RECOMMENDATIONS CAN BE MADE FOR A MORE APPROPRIATE LONG-TERM PLACEMENT. THE MAXIMUM LENGTH OF TIME A CHILD CAN TYPICALLY STAY IS 90 DAYS. AT THE END OF THE TAX YEAR, APPROXIMATELY 150 CHILDREN HAD BEEN SERVED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE HELD BY THE TEXAS GIRLS AND BOYS RANCH FOUNDATION, A TYPE III SUPPORTING ORGANZIATION. ALL FUNDS ARE USED TO SUPPORT OPERATIONS OF THE TEXAS GIRLS & BOYS RANCH.

THE RANCH UTILIZES THE "UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS" PROVISIONS OF ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES GENERALLY ACCEPTED IN THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA. THE PRIMARY TAX POSITION OF THE RANCH IS ITS FILING STATUS AS A TAX EXEMPT ENTITY. THE RANCH DETERMINED THAT IT IS MORE LIKELY THAN NOT THAT THEIR TAX POSITIONS WILL BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE, OR OTHER STATE TAXING AUTHORITIES. THE RANCH IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO EXAMINATIONS BY FEDERAL TAXING AUTHORITIES FOR YEARS BEFORE 2020.
FUNDRAISING EXPENSES REPORTED ON FORM 990, PART VIII, LINE 8B 29,273. COST OF GOOD SOLD REPORTED ON FORM 990, PART VIII, LINE 10B 40.
FUNDRAISING EXPENSES REPORTED ON FORM 990, PART VIII, LINE 8B 29,273. COST OF GOODS SOLD REPORTED ON FORM 990, PART VIII, LINE 10B 40.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A COPY OF THE FORM 990 WAS PRESENTED TO THE BOARD FOR DISCUSSION, REVIEW, AND APPROVAL PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANNUALLY AT THE JANUARY BOARD MEETING EACH DIRECTOR AND OFFICER OF THE TEXAS GIRLS AND BOYS RANCH IS REQUIRED TO REVIEW THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND DISCLOSE ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD ANNUALLY LEADS THE BOARD WHEN REVIEWING THE PRESIDENT'S COMPENSATION. A MARKET ANALYSIS FROM CHILD WELFARE LEAGUE OF AMERICA IS USED WHEN DETERMINING THE PRESIDENT'S COMPENSATION. THE TEXAS GIRLS AND BOYS RANCH DOES NOT HAVE ANY OTHER EMPLOYEES, BESIDES THE PRESIDENT, WHO MEETS THE IRS DEFINITION OF AN OFFICER OR KEY EMPLOYEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE FOR VIEWING BY THE PUBLIC AT THE ORGANIZATION'S OFFICE IN LUBBOCK, TX.
THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS HAVE ASSIGNED MEMBERS TO AN AUDIT COMMITTEE TO OVERSEE THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT AUDIT AND SELECT THE INDEPENDENT FINANCIAL STATEMENT AUDITOR.
